author: VNExplorer
title: Cusco, Loreto y otras siete regiones alcanzarán temperaturas superiores a 35°C advierte Senamhi
text: El Servicio Nacional de Meteorología e Hidrología del Perú (Senamhi) ha emitido una alerta naranja para nueve regiones a partir de hoy, jueves 1 de agosto, debido a un aumento significativo en las temperaturas. Este fenómeno meteorológico se extenderá por más de 60 horas. El aviso N° 189 de la institución advierte que, desde hoy a las 8:00 a.m. hasta el sábado 3 de agosto a las 11:59 p.m., se prevé un aumento en la temperatura diurna en la selva peruana, con temperaturas máximas superiores a 35°C. Las regiones afectadas incluyen Amazonas, Cusco, Huánuco, Junín, Loreto, Madre de Dios, Pasco, San Martín y Ucayali. Regiones de la selva presentarán altas temperaturas hasta el sábado 3 de agosto. Foto: Andina Senamhi emitió alerta naranja en la selva Además, se espera un incremento en la radiación ultravioleta (UV), lo que podría elevar el riesgo de exposición solar. También se prevén ráfagas de viento que podrían alcanzar hasta 45 km/h, especialmente durante las horas de la tarde. En cuanto a las precipitaciones, no se descarta la posibilidad de chubascos aislados en la selva norte y en la selva alta del centro-sur. La alerta naranja advierte sobre fenómenos meteorológicos potencialmente peligrosos. Por lo tanto, las autoridades han solicitado a la ciudadanía mantenerse informada sobre el desarrollo de la situación mediante los canales oficiales y seguir estrictamente las recomendaciones e instrucciones proporcionadas para minimizar los riesgos. Incremento de temperatura en la sierra y centro de Perú El Senamhi ha informado que, durante hoy jueves y el viernes 2 de agosto, se anticipa un aumento en la temperatura diurna en la sierra norte y centro del Perú. Se espera una escasa nubosidad durante la mañana, un incremento en la radiación ultravioleta (UV) y ráfagas de viento con velocidades cercanas a los 33 km/h. Las regiones afectadas por estas condiciones son Amazonas, Áncash, Cajamarca, Huánuco, Junín, La Libertad, Lima, Pasco, Piura y San Martín. Para el jueves 1 de agosto, se prevé que las temperaturas máximas en la sierra norte oscilarán entre 23 °C y 29 °C, mientras que en la sierra centro se esperan valores entre 20 °C y 23 °C. Descenso en la temperatura nocturna La institución adscrita al Ministerio del Ambiente pronostica un descenso significativo en las temperaturas nocturnas en la sierra centro y sur, con una vigencia de 71 horas. Según el anuncio, desde el viernes 2 de agosto hasta el domingo 4, se prevén ráfagas de viento con velocidades cercanas a los 35 km/h, escasa nubosidad e incremento en la temperatura diurna. Los departamentos que podrían experimentar estas condiciones son Áncash, Apurímac, Arequipa, Ayacucho, Cusco, Huancavelica, Huánuco, Junín, Lima, Moquegua, Pasco, Puno y Tacna. Se estima que el viernes 2 de agosto, las temperaturas mínimas podrían descender a aproximadamente -8 °C en localidades situadas a más de 3200 m s. n. m. en la sierra centro, y alrededor de -13 °C en áreas por encima de los 4000 m s. n. m. en la sierra sur. Asimismo, se espera que para el sábado 3 de agosto, las temperaturas mínimas en la sierra centro puedan acercarse a los -9 °C, mientras que en las zonas de mayor altitud en la sierra sur, podrían registrar temperaturas alrededor de -13 °C.

author: Sudinfo
title: Grève nationale ce lundi 31 mars : voici tous les services qui seront inaccessibles à Liège
text:
Grève nationale ce lundi 31 mars : voici tous les services qui seront inaccessibles à Liège
Plusieurs services de la Ville de Liège seront donc fermés ce lundi, annonce les autorités communales qui précisent que cette liste pourrait encore être modifiée et mise à jour.
Accueil
Les sites suivants seront fermés : le central téléphonique ; l’accueil de la Batte 10 ; l’accueil en Féronstrée 86 (Gestion financière) ; l’accueil de la rue de Namur 2.
Affaires citoyennes
L’ensemble des services (mairies de quartier, naissances, étrangers…) seront inaccessibles au public. Les démarches qui peuvent se faire en ligne restent néanmoins possibles via le portail e-Guichet.
Archives
Le service Gestion documentaire et Archives ne sera pas accessible. « Nous vous invitons à nous contacter par mail à l’adresse archives@liege.be ou à nous transmettre votre demande de recherche généalogique ou urbanistique via le portail e-Guichet. Nous traiterons vos demandes dans les meilleurs délais », assure la Ville.
Bibliothèques
La bibliothèque Saint-Léonard sera ouverte. Toutes les autres seront fermées.
Crèches
Toutes les crèches seront fermées.
Collectes de déchets
La collecte habituelle hebdomadaire (déchets ménagers, PMC, papiers-cartons, organiques) risque d’être fortement perturbée ce lundi.
Les quartiers touchés sont : Saint-Léonard, Coronmeuse, Thier-à-Liège, Sainte-Marguerite, Sainte-Walburge, Rocourt. Dans le cas où les collectes n’auraient pas été réalisées lundi 31 mars, il est demandé aux habitants concernés de laisser leurs déchets à rue. Une collecte « de rattrapage » aura en effet lieu le lendemain, mardi 1er avril, pour ramasser à la fois les déchets du lundi et ceux du mardi, et ainsi normaliser la situation dans les meilleurs délais et dans la mesure du possible.
Si la collecte « de rattrapage » ne pouvait toutefois avoir lieu durant la journée du 1er avril pour des raisons indépendantes de la volonté de la Ville et du collecteur, il est demandé aux citoyens de rentrer leurs déchets et de les représenter la semaine suivante. La Ville de Liège compte sur la compréhension et la collaboration des Liégeois.
CPAS
Le guichet d’Accueil des nouvelles demandes du CPAS, situé à la Cité administrative, sera fermé au public ce 31 mars. Pour le reste des services ouverts au public, il y a de possibles perturbations en raison du risque de blocage.
Musées
Le musée de La Boverie est fermé, comme tous les lundis.
Contenus sponsorisés
Notre sélection vidéo

author: AAP
title: Global shift to renewables ‘a race Australia can win’
text:
If Australia doesn’t want to remain “the last link in the global supply chain”, the government must think big on renewables and take inspiration from its neighbours, the prime minister will say.
Overseas, the US government in 2022 committed to its Inflation Reduction Act that will provide $A520 billion in programs and funding to accelerate the net-zero transition.
The EU’s 2020 Green Deal serves a similar purpose, as does Japan’s Green Transformation Act released in February 2023.
With fears these schemes could encourage capital, resources and talent to go elsewhere, Australia’s federal government may have to respond in kind.
Anthony Albanese is expected to set the scene of Australia’s energy future in a speech to the University of Newcastle on Friday.
“You can see that in the unprecedented investments the United States and the EU and Japan and Korea are making in their industrial bases,” he will say.
“I don’t want us to spend another generation as the last link in the global supply chain.
“I want to see more Australian workers and Australians firms adding value here.”
The government has already legislated a target that would reduce emissions by 43 per cent come 2030, and dedicated $15 billion to a National Reconstruction Fund aimed at boosting productivity.
All advanced economies are on a decarbonisation journey and the prime minister says “it’s a race that Australia can win”.
“In all of this, we must be prepared to think big.”
Australia is the world’s largest supplier of lithium, the fourth largest provider of cobalt and the third of rare earth minerals, and maintains a workforce skilled in safe extraction.
This means the nation could also export resources required for clean energy to other countries, diversify its trade partners and help facilitate the emergence of new technologies.
“We don’t have to go dollar-for-dollar in our spending,” the prime minister will say.
“But we can go toe-to-toe on the quality and impact of our policies.
“That’s why I talk about Australia as a renewable energy superpower – because that’s the truly global scale of the opportunity.”

author: @englishjagrannews
title: Bangladesh Unrest: Diplomatic Passport Of Ex- PM Sheikh Hasina Revoked By Interim Govt
text: - By [Anushka Vats](/authors/anushka-vats) - Published: Fri, 23 Aug 2024 09:02 AM (IST) - Source:JND The interim government of Bangladesh revoked the passport of ex-Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. An order issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs directed Hasina along with advisers, former cabinet members and all members of the recently dissolved National Parliament, to surrender their diplomatic passports. The directive issued on Thursday, as reported by Xinhua news agency, also extends to the family members of those affected. The notification, signed by Faisal Hasan, senior information officer of the Ministry of Home Affairs, details the process for issuing general passports in exchange for diplomatic passports. The notification, meanwhile, doesn't mention the actions that will be taken against those not following the orders. This comes amid the tense situation in Bangladesh following protests led mainly by students demanding an end to a quota system for government jobs. Sheikh Hasina left Bangladesh for New Delhi on August 5 after stepping down as Prime Minister. An interim government in Bangladesh, led by Nobel Peace laureate Muhammad Yunus, 84, was sworn in as the head of the interim government on August 8. ALSO READ: [RG Kar Rape-Murder Case: CBI Gets Court Nod For Polygraph Test On Ex-Principal Sandip Ghosh, Four Others](https://english.jagran.com/india/rg-kar-rape-murder-case-cbi-gets-court-nod-for-polygraph-test-on-former-principal-sandip-ghosh-four-others-10182504) Earlier this week, Indian High Commisioner to Bangladesh Pranay Verma paid a courtesy call on the Adviser for Foreign Affairs of the interim Government of Bangladesh Md. Touhid Hossain at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Dhaka. He congratulated the Adviser for Foreign Affairs on his new responsibilities, according to a statement issued by the Bangladesh Ministry of Foreign Affairs. He referred to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's good wishes to the Chief Adviser and expressed the willingness of the Government of India to work with the interim government to fulfill the shared aspirations of peoples of both countries for peace, security and development, stated the press release. (With inputs from agencies)

author: VNExplorer
title: Astros use hot start to rout Orioles, pick up series sweep over AL East rival
text: HOUSTON — Framber Valdez pitched seven solid innings and Jeremy Peña and Yainer Diaz had three RBIs apiece to give the Houston Astros a 8-1 win over the Baltimore Orioles on Sunday and complete a three-game sweep. “That’s Astros baseball right there,” manager Joe Espada said. “That’s what we expect from our team. … We did so many things so well. That was a series we needed as a club.” It’s just the second time the Orioles have been swept this season after losing three in a row to the Cardinals from May 20-22. Valdez (6-5) allowed six hits and a run with seven strikeouts in seven innings to bounce back after consecutive losses. He said sweeping a team like the Orioles was important for the Astros, who are trying to recover after a tough start to the season. “It feels good,” Valdez said in Spanish through a translator. “It is just a good sign that we’re doing well, we’re getting better and … we’re getting to the spot where we want to be, which is No. 1.” Jose Altuve hit a leadoff homer as the Astros jumped on Albert Suárez (3-2) for four runs in the first. Alex Bregman had a season-high four hits for Houston, which extended its winning streak to five games. “They’re a great ballclub and they’ve got a great pitching staff,” Bregman said. “But we swung the bat really well today and all series long and was very proud of the effort and the preparation of the guys and we’ve got to keep that rolling.” Jordan Westburg homered for a second straight game to extend Baltimore’s franchise-record streak of games with a home run to 22. But the Orioles couldn’t do much else offensively as they managed just one run for a second straight game. “We’ve just got to flush this one,” manager Brandon Hyde said of the series. “Not a whole lot went right. We need to let this one go.” Suárez allowed a career-high 10 hits and tied a career most with five runs in five innings. “There were some balls just in the middle part of the plate there early in the count that they were really aggressive on and did some damage on him early,” Hyde said. “I thought he did a decent job after that, but they were squaring balls up in that inning.” Bryan King struck out one in a scoreless eighth for Houston in his major league debut and Luis Contreras allowed one hit in his debut in the ninth. Altuve sent Suárez’s first pitch out of the park for his 38th career leadoff homer to make it 1-0. Bregman doubled and scored on a one-out single by Diaz. Peña doubled to drive in Diaz and extend the lead to 3-0. Mauricio Dubón made it 4-0 with his RBI single on a line drive to center field. César Salazar hit a single to open Houston’s fourth before a one-out double by Bregman. The Orioles intentionally walked Yordan Alvarez to load the bases and a sacrifice fly by Diaz left Houston up 5-0. Colton Cowser singled with one out in the fifth, but was erased when Adley Rutschman grounded into a force out. Ryan Mountcastle singled after that, but Anthony Santander also grounded into a forceout to end the inning. Westburg’s home run came with one out in the sixth to cut the lead to 5-1. Bregman singled with one out in the sixth and a single by Diaz came with two outs in the inning. They both scored when Peña smacked a double to left-center field to make it 7-1. Altuve and Bregman hit consecutive singles to start the eighth and Altuve scored on a sacrifice fly by Diaz with two outs to extend the lead to 8-1. More from Sportsnet Fried and Kelenic lead Braves over Yankees for eighth win in 10 games Diaz sparks offence as Rays earn win over Skenes, Pirates

author: @andaluciainf
title: Muere un anciano y una mujer resulta herida grave en un accidente de coche en Níjar | Andalucía Información. Todas las noticias de Granada
text: Un hombre ha muerto y una mujer ha resultado herida de carácter grave a causa de un accidente de tráfico registrado esta tarde en la carretera AL-3106 en Níjar (Almería), según informa el servicio unificado de emergencias 112 de Andalucía. El siniestro se produjo sobre las 17.45 horas en la carretera AL-3106, en el municipio de Níjar. Ambos ancianos viajaban en el mismo turismo que se salió de la vía cuando circulaban por la carretera que va desde Las Hortichuelas a las Negras. Tras el aviso a 112 y la activación de los operativos, hasta el lugar se desplazaron servicios sanitarios, Guardia Civil de Tráfico, Protección Civil de Níjar y Mantenimiento de la Vía. El hombre, de unos ochenta años de edad, ha fallecido en el lugar del accidente mientras que a la mujer, también de edad avanzada, consiguieron estabilizarla y trasladarla con vida al Hospital Torrecárdenas. Se ha activado el protocolo judicial. Envía tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)
